poem:
Title: "In Yorkshire's Quiet Hostelry"

In Lelley, a tale erupted,
from Vauxhall's secret cavity.
Four men, silently corrupted,
lure of coca's gravity.

Stags Head Inn bore silent witness,
to the crime routine and stark,
an embodiment of brisk business,
in Yorkshire's muted dark.

Beneath the scent of ancient ale,
a village secret whispered,
500 kilos - a white tale,
In daylight, sharply considered.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Four arrested after £40m cocaine haul found in van in Yorkshire pub car park Four men have been arrested after £40m worth of cocaine was found in the back of a van in a Yorkshire village pub car park. About 500kg of the drug was discovered in a Vauxhall Vivaro in the car park of the Stags Head Inn in Lelley, East Yorkshire, the National Crime Agency said. It is believed that the drugs had". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
